sen.e: In April 1992, the National Association of Takimono Senko Unions designated the 18th of April as 'Incense Day' because April was the time when, as identified by the above-mentioned descriptions in the Nihonshoki, Jinsui Koboku had arrived Japan for the first time, and the word "香" ('incense' in English) can be associated with 18th day, as the word can be divided into "十" (ten) and "八" (eight), thus equaling to 18.
